page.title: 12O.A.P. HOME SUTTON COLDFIELD
page.content: Over the fence from John Willmott School is{'Heathways',}a residential home for old and infirm people. A sheltered and comfortable environment is provided for those who would find it difficult to cope entirely by themselves.The oldest resident is{97,}the youngest{57.}Staff are employed by the local authority. We{interviewed}over twenty residents. Most had lived in Birmingham all their lives.Everyone thought highly of the staff and enjoyed living there. They had seen many changes in their life-times,especially the large{growth in Sutton's population and area since the 1950's.Birmingham had become a {multi-racial}society.Many expressed concern with{vandalism}and advocated corporal punishment.They would have liked more police for safety.One lady sewed,made teddy-bears and watched{TV.
